info.title: Core API Reference
info.description:
The Counterbalance Core API provides powerful, programmatic access to the Counterbalance platform and powers its feature-rich building management UI. Everything that is possible via the Counterbalance System Console is powered by this API.

This documentation walks through the API endpoints and their usage.

## Supported HTTP Operations
Our APIs supports the `GET`,`POST`,`PUT`,`PATCH`,`DELETE`, & `OPTIONS` verbs. General usage of these verbs is outlined in the following table.

Verb | Description
-----|------------
`GET`     | Retrieves existing resources
`POST`    | Creates a new resource and returns it
`PUT`     | Creates a new resource within or attached to an existing resource and returns the new resource
`PATCH`   | Updates an existing resource and returns the updated resource
`DELETE`  | Removes an existing resource and returns nothing
`OPTIONS` | List available verbs against a resource

## Status Codes

Our APIs return standard HTTP status codes. All status codes used are outlined below. 

### Success Codes

Code | Response | Description
-----|----------|---------
**200** | `Ok` | The request was completed successfully. Response body will vary.
**201** | `Created` | In response to a PUT or POST request, the resource was created successfully. The new resource's ID will be returned in the response body.
**204** | `No Content` | The request was completed successfully and there is no response body to return. Such as when an object has been deleted. The response body will be _null_.

### Error Codes

Code | Response | Description
-----|----------|---------
**400** | `Bad Request` | The request was malformed, provided incorrect/incomplete/conflicting parameters, or the requested endpoint does not exist. The response body will contain additional information about why the error has occurred. Do not repeat the request without modifying it first.
**401** | `Unauthorized` | The request requires an Authorization header and a valid token but either neither was provided or the provided token has expired. Refer to the error message provided to determine the proper course of action. 
**403** | `Forbidden` | The API authentication was successful but the user does not have adequate permissions to satisfy the request or the tenant account is locked.
**404** | `Not Found` | The resource requested does not exist or was not found.
**409** | `Conflict` | The provided combination of parameters results in a conflict and the resource cannot be updated. The error message output will provide additional information as to why the call cannot be completed.
**5XX** | _`varies`_ | The API encountered an internal error when processing the request. The error message provided may provide additional information. Retrying the request after a few minutes may be successful.

## Authenticating Requests
The authentication requirement for each API varies, but in general, most endpoints will require authentication. 

To authenticate, add an `Authorization` header with a valid **Bearer** token.
```
Authorization: Bearer eyJg...fw5c
```

### Obtaining an Access Token
Follow the steps below to obtain an access token for use with these docs.
1. Open [Counterbalance Single Sign-On](https://sso.counterbalance.io) and login when prompted
2. Click **Copy Token** to copy an access token to your clipboard

### Request Authorization
Some API endpoints require a paid subscription. If a request is made to a paid feature that is not available, a `403 Forbidden` response will be returned. 

Additionally, some platform resources and features are measured against a licensed quota limit. If an attempt is made to add additional resources once a quota limit has been reached, a `403 Forbidden` response will be returned.

## Submitting Data
When submitting non-binary data via a `POST`, `PUT`, or `PATCH` endpoint, the data payload must be in JSON.

Procedures for submitting other types of data to platform APIs are documented on a per-endpoint basis. 

## Handling Errors
All API errors will return a common error response format. The response will provide an 

### Error Logging

Most errors are automatically logged and reported. These errors will return a `logging_hash` entry ID in the error response body.

```json
{
    "error": {
        ...
    },
    "logging_hash": "034dd6ad00770337bb07e906d919ed50f8884e86"
}
```

This entry ID is also added as a header in the response.

```
X-Counterbalance-Log-Hash: 034dd6ad00770337bb07e906d919ed50f8884e86
```

get.description:
Retrieve a list of site objects

**Required Permissions:** `*`,`sites:*`,`sites:site:*`,`sites:site:list`

### Filtering Results
A combination of one or more query parameters may be used to filter returned data. Query parameters are stacked such that using multiple parameters will result in a narrower data set.

Wildcard searches are permitted on all query parameters. Wildcard searches are case insensitive and all data is forced to lowercase for matching purposes. See usage examples below.

<!--
title: "Site Code Wildcard Search"
lineNumbers: false
-->
```text
https://api.counterbalance.io/v1/site?code=*MN*
```
<!--
title: "Site Name Wildcard Search"
lineNumbers: false
-->
```text
https://api.counterbalance.io/v1/site?name=*elementary*
```

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Filter results by site code. Accepts * wildcard searches.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter results by site name. Accepts * wildcard searches.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Filter sites by description. Accepts * wildcard searches.

post.description:
Create a new site object

**Required Permissions:** `*`,`sites:*`,`sites:site:*`,`sites:site:create`

> **Heads Up** This endpoint is subject to `site` quota availabilty

### Defining Building Category & Type
New sites must be defined with a building `category` and `type`. In some cases, a type will have additional sub-types, in which case, the `sub_type` paramater must also be provided. 

Category, type, and sub_type are all defined using an index ID. The various indexes and their values can be found in [this support article](https://counterbalance.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/5405264196499).

put.description:
Create a new address object and attach it to a site

**Required Permissions:** `*`,`sites:*`,`sites:site:*`,`sites:site:update`

### Address Geocoding
By default, new addresses are geocoded to determine their GPS coordinates, timezone, and to fill-in various extended properties such as the locality, country, and ZIP or postcode. 

Geocoding is an optional process and can be skipped by setting `geocode` to `false` in the request body. If geocoding is skipped, the following additional body parameters become required: `county`, `country`, `postcode`, `timezone`

parameters.name: @site
parameters.description: A valid site UUID for which to assign this address

get.description:
### Synopsis
Retrieve the details for the specified address

### Prerequisites
The following prerequisites are required for this endpoint:
* An active tenant account
* Permissions _(at least one):_ `*`,`sites:*`,`sites:address:*`,`sites:address:read`

post.description:
Perform operations on an address

**Required Permissions:** `*`,`sites:*`,`sites:site:*`,`sites:address:*`,`sites:address:update`

### Supported Operations
The following operations are currently supported:

#### Address Normalization
An existing address object can be normalized or re-normalized by specifying the operation as `normalize`. The address' existing lines, city, and state values are used to generate a normalization query and updates are performed based on these values. If normalization data is incorrect, try adjusting these parameters and re-normalizing. 

When an address is normalized, the following properties are looked up and overridden: `city`,`state`,`latitude`,`longitude`,`postcode`,`locality`,`county`,`country`,`timezone`

get.description:
Retrieve a list of floors

**Required Permissions:** `*`,`sites:*`,`sites:floor:*`,`sites:floor:list`

post.description:
Create a new floor and assign it to a site

**Required Permissions:** `*`,`sites:*`,`sites:floor:*`,`sites:floor:create`

delete.description:
Delete a floor

**Required Permissions:** `*`,`sites:*`,`sites:floor:*`,`sites:floor:delete`

<!-- theme: danger -->
> **Danger** This cannot be undone!

get.description:
Retrieve a list of rooms

**Required Permissions:** `*`,`sites:*`,`sites:room:*`,`sites:room:list`

post.description:
Create a new room and assign it to a floor

**Required Permissions:** `*`,`sites:*`,`sites:room:*`,`sites:room:create`

### Defining Room Occupancy
The room occupancy classification must be specifid in the `occupancy` body parameter. One of the [International Building Code (IBC)](https://buildingcodetrainer.com/building-occupancy-classification-occupancy-types-explained/) occupancy codes is required and all occupancies are considered valid values.

### Defining Room Area
The `area` body parameter is required and should contain the net area of the room in localized units (square meters or square feet). Only integer values are permitted.

### Defining Room Volume
The room volume can be explicitly provided in the `volume` body parameter. The volume should be expressed in the same localized units as the room area. Only integer values are permitted.

If the volume is not defined, the `ceiling_height` body parameter, if provided, is used to calculate the room volume using the area specified.

patch.description:
Update a room

### Prerequisites
The following prerequisites are required for this endpoint:
* An active tenant account
* Permissions _(at least one):_ `*`,`sites:*`,`sites:room:*`,`sites:room:update`

delete.description:
Delete a room

**Required Permissions:** `*`,`sites:*`,`sites:room:*`,`sites:room:delete`

<!-- theme: danger -->
> _**Heads Up** This cannot be undone!_

get.description:
Geocode a search query

**Required Permissions:** `*`,`view:console*`

### Accepted Queries
*coming soon*

error.console: Specify either an IANA timezone ID, coordinates, or an address ID
Parameters timezone, coordinates, and address are mutually exclusive. Specify only one.
The address ID ... is not geocoded and we have no coordinates to check

get.description:
### Synopsis
Retrieve timezone details including the current time

### Prerequisites
The following prerequisites are required for this endpoint:

* An active tenant account
* Permissions _(at least one):_ `*`,`sites:*`,`sites:utilities:*`,`sites:utilities:timezone`
* Licensed Feature: `sites_base`

### Specifying Coordinates or Address ID
Timezone details can be obtained for a specified set of coordinates or by specifying a geocoded address object ID. Either the `coordinates` or `@address` query parameters must be passed, but not both.

If the specified address ID has not been geocoded, an error will be returned.

### Specifying am IANA Timezone ID
Timezone details can be obtained for any Timezone by specifying the IANA timezone ID

<!-- theme: warning-->
> _Parameters `timezone`, `coordinates` and `@address` are mutually exclusive. Passing more than one will result in an error_

parameters.name: coordinates
parameters.description: Get the timezone for the specified coordinates

parameters.name: @address
parameters.description: Get the timezone for the specified address ID

get.description:
Retrieve the tenant account for the authenticated user

__Required Permissions:__ `*`,`tenant:*`,`tenant:account:*`,`tenant:account:read`

value.success_message: The new tenant account was created! Email confirmation required.

post.description:
Create a new tenant account (aka, account signup)

__Required Permissions:__ _none_

### Accepting the Terms of Service
The [Terms of Service](https://www.counterbalance.io/terms) must be accepted before the account can be created. The `accept_terms` body field must be set to `true` in order for the request to be completed successfully.

### Account Confirmation
New tenant accounts created via this endpoint must be confirmed before they will be activated. The user will be emailed a confirmation code and the account must be confirmed using the __Confirm Tenant Account__ operations endpoint.

### Password Strength
The password specified must meet the following requirements:

* Must be at least 8-characters in length
* Lower case (a-z), upper case (A-Z) and numbers (0-9)
* Special characters (!@#$%^&*)
* No more than 2 identical characters in a row

NIST recommends a minimum character length of 8, and suggests that length is a better indicator of strength than complexity.

<!-- theme: warning -->
> **Heads Up:** A password will be rejected if it contains common dictionary phrases or the user's first name, last name, or shortname.

password.description: The tenant owner's desired login password

company_name.description: The name of the new tenant account

accept_terms.description: Set to `true` to indicate acceptance of the Counterbalance Terms of Service

patch.description:
Update the tenant account for the authenticated user

__Required Permissions:__ `*`,`tenant:*`,`tenant:account:*`,`tenant:account:update`

name.description: The company or organization name for the tenant

primary_contact.description: UUID of the user designated as the primary contact for the tenant account

delete.description:
Delete the tenant account of the authenticated user

The following prerequisites are required for this endpoint:
* An active tenant account
* Permissions _(at least one):_ `*`,`tenant:*`,`tenant:account:*`,`tenant:account:delete`

### Immediate Account Termination

value.success_message: Tenant account has been successfully confirmed!

post.description:
Confirm a newly-created tenant account

The following prerequisites are required for this endpoint:
* The tenant account confirmation code _(emailed to the new user)_
* Permissions _(at least one):_ `*`,`tenant:*`,`tenant:account:*`,`tenant:account:update`

> **Please Note:** A confirm operation can only be completed by the user who created the tenant acccount
Set a deletion PIN that allows Counterbalance Support to permanently delete a tenant account

Mark the tenant account for the authenticated user as having completed onboarding

__Required Permissions:__ `*`,`tenant:*`,`tenant:account:*`,`tenant:account:update`

requestBody.description: *No request body is necesssary for this request*

get.description:
Retrieve platform preferences set for the authenticated user's tenant account

__Required Permissions:__ `*`,`tenant:*`,`tenant:account:*`,`tenant:account:read`

patch.description:
Update platform preferences set for the authenticated user's tenant account

__Required Permissions:__ `*`,`tenant:*`,`tenant:account:*`,`tenant:account:update`

get.description:
Retrieve a list of authorized platform features and a summary of metered tenant objects and their usage for the authenticated user's tenant account

__Required Permissions:__ `*`,`tenant:*`,`tenant:quota:*`,`tenant:quota:read`

> **Please Note:** This endpoint will return all the features and quotas for the tenant account, regardless of the authenticated user's ability to use or access them

parameters.name: features_only
parameters.description: Only return the authorized features, excludes quota summary and usage details

get.description:
Get current air quality

**Required Permissions:** `*`,`wx:*`,`wx:airquality:*`,`wx:airquality:read`

### Specifying the Location
Air quality data can be obtained for a specified set of coordinates or by specifying a geocoded address object ID. Either the `coordinates` or `@address` query parameters must be passed, but not both. Passing more than one will result in an error 

<!-- theme: info-->
> **Please Note:**
> If the specified address ID has not been geocoded, an error will be returned.

### Language
By default, data is returned in English. To return data in another language, pass the `langugage` query parameter and set it to a valid IETF language code

error.console: Specify either coordinates or an address ID
The address ID 8ac7d5dc-803d-40ac-bc37-16c0dbffe5d8 could not be found in the database

The address ID 8ac7d5dc-803d-40ac-bc37-16c0dbffe5d8 is not geocoded and we have no coordinates to check

Get forecasted daily air quality

**Required Permissions:** `*`,`wx:*`,`wx:airquality:*`,`wx:airquality:read`

### Specifying the Location
Air quality data can be obtained for a specified set of coordinates or by specifying a geocoded address object ID. Either the `coordinates` or `@address` query parameters must be passed, but not both. Passing more than one will result in an error 

<!-- theme: info-->
> **Please Note:**
> If the specified address ID has not been geocoded, an error will be returned.

### Language
By default, data is returned in English. To return data in another language, pass the `langugage` query parameter and set it to a valid IETF language code

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: The number of forecast outlook days to return

parameters.name: coordinates
parameters.description: Get air quality for the specified lat/lon position

parameters.name: @address
parameters.description: Get air quality for the specified address ID

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Language in which search results should be returned. Should be one of supported IETF language tags, case insensitive.

areas.name: North Coast
areas.summary: High Surf Advisory in effect from 10:00 PM PST until Wednesday, 10:00 PM PST.  Source: U.S. National Weather Service
areas.details:
...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 PM
PST WEDNESDAY...

* WHAT...Large breaking waves of 18 to 21 feet expected in the
  surf zone.

* WHERE...North Coast and Central Coast.

* WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 10 PM PST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Dangerous conditions along the coast and in the surf
  zone. Localized beach erosion may also occur due to large waves.

PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...

Large waves may break and run up beaches farther than usual. Keep
your distance from the coastline and never turn your back on the
ocean.

Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to
dangerous surf conditions.

&&

Parameters coordinates and address are mutually exclusive. Specify only one.
The address ID 8ac7d5dc-803d-40ac-bc37-16c0dbffe5d8 is not geocoded and we have no coordinates to check

get.description:
Retrieve current severe weather alerts and advisories

### Prerequisites
The following prerequisites are required for this endpoint:

* An active tenant account
* Permissions _(at least one):_ `*`,`sites:*`,`sites:weather:*`,`sites:weather:alerts`
* Licensed Feature: `weather_alerts`

### Specifying the Location
Weather alerts and advisories can be obtained for a specified set of coordinates or by specifying a geocoded address object ID. Either the `coordinates` or `@address` query parameters must be passed, but not both. Passing more than one will result in an error 

<!-- theme: info-->
> **Please Note:**
> If the specified address ID has not been geocoded, an error will be returned.

### Language
By default, data is returned in English. To return data in another language, pass the `langugage` query parameter and set it to a valid IETF language code.

<!-- theme: warning-->
> _The API supports any valid IETF language code but alert data may not be available in the specified language_

error.console: Specify either coordinates or an address ID
The address ID 8ac7d5dc-803d-40ac-bc37-16c0dbffe5d8 could not be found in the database
Parameters coordinates and address are mutually exclusive. Specify only one.
The address ID 8ac7d5dc-803d-40ac-bc37-16c0dbffe5d8 is not geocoded and we have no coordinates to check

get.description:
Retrieve detailed current weather conditions

**Required Permissions:** `*`,`wx:*`,`wx:conditions:*`,`wx:conditions:read`

### Specifying the Location
Weather conditions can be obtained for a specified set of coordinates or by specifying a geocoded address object ID. Either the `coordinates` or `@address` query parameters must be passed, but not both. Passing more than one will result in an error 

<!-- theme: info-->
> **Please Note:**
> If the specified address ID has not been geocoded, an error will be returned.

### Units
By default, data is returned in Imperial units. To return data in Metric units, pass the `metric` query parameter and set it to _true_. 

### Language
By default, data is returned in English. To return data in another language, pass the `langugage` query parameter and set it to a valid IETF language code

error.console: Specify either coordinates or an address ID, but not both
Specify either coordinates or an address ID
Invalid duration value. Allowed value(s): 1, 5, 10, or 15
The address ID 8ac7d5dc-803d-40ac-bc37-16c0dbffe5d8 is not geocoded and we have no coordinates to check

get.description:
Retrieve a detailed daily weather forecast

 **Required Permissions:** `*`,`wx:*`,`wx:forecast:*`,`wx:forecast:read` 

 ### Specifying the Location
Weather forecasts can be obtained for a specified set of coordinates or by specifying a geocoded address object ID. Either the `coordinates` or `@address` query parameters must be passed, but not both. Passing more than one will result in an error 

<!-- theme: info-->
> **Please Note:**
> If the specified address ID has not been geocoded, an error will be returned.

### Units
By default, data is returned in Imperial units. To return data in Metric units, pass the `metric` query parameter and set it to _true_. 

### Language
By default, data is returned in English. To return data in another language, pass the `langugage` query parameter and set it to a valid IETF language code

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: The number of forecast outlook days to return

### Language
By default, data is returned in English. To return data in another language, pass the `langugage` query parameter and set it to a valid IETF language code

example-1.description: The air quality is generally acceptable for most individuals. However, sensitive groups may experience minor to moderate symptoms from long-term exposure.

latitude.description: The effective latitude of this request

longitude.description: The effective longitude of this request

timestamp.description: Date and time of the current observation displayed in ISO 8601 format. *For example, 2022-02-23T08:00:00+0000*

description.description: A textual explanation of this air quality result in the requested language.

local.description: Air quality rating on a scale set by local regulating bodies. Scales can vary widely based on location. See [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Air_quality_index) for more information.

global.description: Internationally normalized air quality rating on a scale from 0 to 300 and up, with higher numbers representing worse air quality.

status.description: One-word description of the air quality in the requested language. For example, "Excellent".

status_color.description: A unique color corresponding to the category of this air quality result.

dominant_pollutant.description: The pollutant with the highest concentration.

type.description: Type of pollutant. Please note that more may be added at any time.

name.description: The name of the pollutant in English.

global.description: Internationally normalized air quality rating on a scale from 0 to 300 and up, with higher numbers representing worse air quality.

concentration.description: An object containing the number of pollutant particles per volume of air.

is_met.description: Indicates the quota limit has been reached

data.description: An array of weather alert objects

id.description: A unique numerical identifier for a weather alert.

source.description: The provider of the alert information. By default the source is returned in English (en-US). The alerts are from official Government Meteorological Agencies and leading global weather alert providers.

areas.description: Information about the alert specific to the affected area(s).

name.description: The name of an area which is affected by the alert. The location that was requested falls under the alert area.

summary.description: Text summarizing the alert in the returned area.

status.description: The latest status of the alert in the current area.

start.description: The start date and time of the alert in ISO 8601 format, for example, 2019-10-27T19:39:57-08:00. If the alert crosses multiple time zones the returned time in the response is the local time to the requested coordinate location.

end.description: The end date and time of the alert in ISO 8601 format, for example, 2019-10-27T19:39:57-08:00. If the alert crosses multiple time zones the returned time in the response is the local time to the requested coordinate location.

details.description: Full details associated with the alert. Returned if `details`=True. This field is always returned in the language(s) of choice by the issuing provider and Azure Maps only returns what is created by the provider. Please note, some countries/regions may offer their native language and English. Language parameter wont apply to this field.

units.description: Indicates whether `metric` or `imperial` units are used

timestamp.description: Date and time of the current observation displayed in ISO 8601 format. *For example, 2022-02-23T08:00:00+0000*

phrase.description: Phrase description of the current weather condition. Displayed in specified language.

is_raining.description: Indicates the presence or absence of precipitation. `True` indicates the presence of precipitation, `false` indicates the absence of precipitation.

is_daytime.description: Indicates the time of the day. `True` indicates 'day',', `false` indicates 'night.

apparent_temperature.description: Perceived outdoor temperature caused by the combination of air temperature, relative humidity, and wind speed in specified unit.

wetbulb_temperature.description: The temperature to which air may be cooled by evaporating water into it at constant pressure until it reaches saturation.

windchill_temperature.description: Perceived air temperature on exposed skin due to wind.

relative_humidity.description: Relative humidity is the amount of water vapor present in air expressed as a percentage of the amount needed for saturation at the same temperature.

dewpoint.description: The dewpoint temperature in specified unit. The dewpoint temperature is the temperature that the air must be cooled to in order to reach saturation.

wind.description: Wind details being returned including speed and direction.

degrees.description: Wind direction in Azimuth degrees, starting at true North and continuing in clockwise direction. North is 0 degrees, east is 90 degrees, south is 180 degrees, west is 270 degrees. Possible values 0-359.

localized.description: Direction abbreviation in the specified language.

speed.description: Speed of the wind in specified unit.

gust.description: Wind gust. Wind gust is a sudden, brief increase in speed of the wind.

visibility.description: Visibility in specified unit. A measure of the distance at which an object or light can be clearly discerned.

ceiling.description: Cloud ceiling in specified unit. The ceiling is a measurement of the height of the base of the lowest clouds.

direction.description: Description of the pressure tendency in specified language. One of F=Falling, S=Steady, R=Rising.

Example.summary: Snow between late tonight and tomorrow morning will accumulate 1-2 inches before changing to rain

phrases.long: Plenty of clouds with a coating to an inch of snow late

summary.description: Summary for the main conditions for the requested time period. Notice that summary can cover only part of the time period.

forecasts.description: Forecast data for each requested day.

date.description: Date and time of the current observation displayed in ISO 8601 format. *For example, 2022-02-23T08:00:00+0000*

minimum.description: Minimum temperature for the time period.

maximum.description: Maximum temperature for the time period

short.description: Phrase description of the forecast in specified language. ~30 characters

long.description: Phrase description of the forecast in specified language. ~100 characters

is_raining.description: Indicates the presence or absence of precipitation. True indicates the presence of precipitation, false indicates the absence of precipitation.

precipitation.description: Percent representing the probability of precipitation.

rain.description: Percent representing the probability of rain.

snow.description: Percent representing the probability of snow.

ice.description: Percent representing the probability of ice.

wind.description: Wind details being returned including speed and direction.

degrees.description: Wind direction in Azimuth degrees, starting at true North and continuing in clockwise direction. North is 0 degrees, east is 90 degrees, south is 180 degrees, west is 270 degrees. Possible values 0-359.

localized.description: Direction abbreviation in the specified language.

speed.description: Speed of the wind in specified unit.

gust.description: Wind gust. Wind gust is a sudden, brief increase in speed of the wind.

direction.description: Direction abbreviation in the specified language.

short.description: Phrase description of the forecast in specified language. ~30 characters

long.description: Phrase description of the forecast in specified language. ~100 characters

is_raining.description: Indicates the presence or absence of precipitation. True indicates the presence of precipitation, false indicates the absence of precipitation.

precipitation.description: Percent representing the probability of precipitation.

rain.description: Percent representing the probability of rain.

snow.description: Percent representing the probability of snow.

ice.description: Percent representing the probability of ice.

wind.description: Wind details being returned including speed and direction.

degrees.description: Wind direction in Azimuth degrees, starting at true North and continuing in clockwise direction. North is 0 degrees, east is 90 degrees, south is 180 degrees, west is 270 degrees. Possible values 0-359.

localized.description: Direction abbreviation in the specified language.

speed.description: Speed of the wind in specified unit.

gust.description: Wind gust. Wind gust is a sudden, brief increase in speed of the wind.

direction.description: Direction abbreviation in the specified language.

data.name: Running
data.description: Conditions are very good for running outdoors.

id.description: Numeric ID used to identify the specific index.

name.description: Name of the index, for example, "Construction", "Outdoor Activity", "Flight Delays".

timestamp.description: Date and time of the current observation displayed in ISO 8601 format. *For example, 2022-02-23T08:00:00+0000*

classification.description: Textual description for `value` corresponding to the level that the index value falls under, for example "Very Good".

description.description: A textual explanation that can be used for display purposes to summarize the index value and category. For example, when the index value for Flight Delays is very good, the description will be "Conditions are excellent for flying!".

value.description: Level that the index value falls under, represented by an integer. This value can be 1 through 5.

@addressId.name: @address
@addressId.description: Get data at the coordinates of the specified address ID

coordinates.name: coordinates
coordinates.description: Get data at the specified lat/lon position

language.name: language
language.description: Language in which search results should be returned. Should be one of supported IETF language tags, case insensitive.

metric.name: metric
metric.description: Return the results with metric units instead of imperial units

@siteId.name: @site
@siteId.description: Filter results by their associated site UUID

@floorId.name: @floor
@floorId.description: Filter results by their associated floor UUID

value.success_message: The tenant has been created! Account confirmation is required to unlock the account.
Tenant account has been successfully confirmed!

name.description: The name of the new site

code.description: A unique code to identify the site

default_occupancy.description: The desired default occupancy for rooms added to this site

allowed_occupancy.description: New rooms will be limited to the occupancies provided

code.description: A unique code for the floor

below_grade.description: Indicate if the floor is below grade. Default is `false`

@site.description: A valid site UUID that will contain this floor

area.description: The net area of the room in localized units (integers only)

@floor.description: A valid floor UUID that will contain this room

occupancy.description: The IBC occupancy classification of this room

street.description: An array of address lines, up to two

country.description: The ISO 3166 alpha-3 country code (USA, CAN, etc)

timezone.description: An IANA timezone code for the address

latitude.description: The longitude value of the address

longitude.description: The latitude value of the address

default_occupancy.description: The desired default occupancy for rooms added to this site

allowed_occupancy.description: New rooms will be limited to the occupancies provided

area.description: The net area of the room

@floor.description: The floor the room belongs to
